thread.title: 'Heart' Beats: Top Billboard Hot 100 'Heart' Songs of All Time
thread.title_full: 'Heart' Beats: Top Billboard Hot 100 'Heart' Songs of All Time

author: NHHMS
title: 'Heart' Beats: Top Billboard Hot 100 'Heart' Songs of All Time
text:
Peak Date: Oct. 19, 1991 
38. “Don’t Break The Heart That Loves You”– Connie FrancisPeak Position: No. 1 (one week)Peak Date: March 31, 1962 
37. “Don’t Phunk With My Heart”– The Black Eyed PeasPeak Position: No. 3Peak Date: June 25, 2005 
36. “Heart Attack”– Olivia Newton-John Peak Position: No. 3Peak Date: Nov. 6, 1982 
35. “Heart and Soul”– T’PauPeak Position: No. 4Peak Date: Aug. 8, 1987 
34. “Hungry Heart”– Bruce SpringsteenPeak Position: No. 5Peak Date: Dec. 27, 1980 
33. “Where Does My Heart Beat Now”– Celine DionPeak Position: No. 4Peak Date: March 2, 1991 
32. “With Every Beat of My Heart”– Taylor DaynePeak Position: No. 5Peak Date: Dec. 16, 1989 
31. “Groove Is in the Heart”– Deee-LitePeak Position: No. 4Peak Date: Nov. 17, 1990 
30. “Wooden Heart”– Joe DowellPeak Position: No. 1 (one week)Peak Date: Aug. 28, 1961 
29. “Heart of Glass”– BlondiePeak Position: No. 1 (one week)Peak Date: April 28, 1979 
28. “My Heart is an Open Book”– Carl Dobkins, Jr.Peak Position: No. 3Peak Date: Aug. 3, 1959 
27. “Time (Clock of the Heart) – Culture ClubPeak Position: No. 2Peak Date: June 18, 1983 
26. “Heartbeat – It’s a Lovebeat”– The DeFranco Family featuring Tony DeFranco​Peak Position: No. 3Peak Date: Nov. 17, 1973 
25. “Heartache Tonight”– EaglesPeak Position: No. 1 (one week)Peak Date: Nov. 10, 1979 
24. “Heart of Gold”– Neil YoungPeak Position: No. 1 (one week)Peak Date: March 18, 1972 
23. “Every Heartbeat”– Amy GrantPeak Position: No. 2Peak Date: Aug. 17, 1991 
22. “Heartbreak Hotel”– Whitney Houston featuring Faith Evans & Kelly PricePeak Position: No. 2Peak Date: March 20, 1999 
21. “Open Your Heart”– MadonnaPeak Position: No. 1 (two weeks)Peak Date: Feb. 7, 1987 
20. “Stereo Hearts”– Gym Class Heroes Ft. Adam LevinePeak Position: 4Peak Date: Oct. 15, 2011 
19. “Burning Heart”– SurvivorPeak Date: Feb. 1, 1986 
18. “Listen to Your Heart”– RoxettePeak Position: 1, 1 weekPeak Date: Nov. 4, 1989 
17. “Where Do Broken Hearts Go”– Whitney HoustonPeak Position: 1, 2 weeksPeak Date: Apr. 23, 1988 
16. “Stop Draggin’ My Heart Around”– Stevie Nicks with Tom Petty and the HeartbreakersPeak Position: 3Peak Date: Sept. 5, 1981 
15. “Queen of Hearts”– Juice NewtonPeak Position: 2Peak Date: Sept. 19, 1981 
14. “Heartless”– Kanye WestPeak Date: Feb. 21, 2009 
13. “Break Your Heart”– Taio Cruz Ft. LudacrisPeak Position: 1, 1 weekPeak Date: Mar. 20, 2010 
12. “I Don’t Have the Heart”– James IngramPeak Position: 1, 1 weekPeak Date: Oct. 20, 1990 
11. “Two Hearts”– Phil CollinsPeak Position: 1, 2 weeksPeak Date: Jan. 21, 1989 
10. “Cold Hearted”– Paula AbdulPeak Position: 1, 1 weekPeak Date: Sept. 2, 1989 
9. “How Can You Mend a Broken Heart”– Bee GeesPeak Position: 1, 4 weeksPeak Date: Aug. 7, 1971 
8. “Harden My Heart”– QuarterflashPeak Position: 3Peak Date: Feb. 13, 1982 
7. “Owner of a Lonely Heart”– YesPeak Position: 1, 2 weeksPeak Date: Jan. 21, 1984 
6. “Heartaches by the Number”– Guy MitchellPeak Position: 1, 2 weeksPeak Date: Dec. 14, 1959 
5. “My Heart Has a Mind of Its Own”– Connie FrancisPeak Position: 1, 2 weeksPeak Date: Sept. 26, 1960 
4. “Quit Playing Games (With My Heart)”– Backstreet BoysPeak Position: 2Peak Date: Sept. 6, 1997 
3. “Don’t Go Breaking My Heart”– Elton John & Kiki DeePeak Position: 1, 4 weeksPeak Date: Aug. 7, 1976 
2. “Total Eclipse of the Heart”– Bonnie TylerPeak Position: 1, 4 weeksPeak Date: Oct. 1, 1983 
1. “Un-Break My Heart”– Toni BraxtonPeak Position: 1, 11 weeksPeak Date: Dec. 7, 1996 
The 50 biggest “heart” songs chart is based on actual performance on the weekly Billboard Hot 100, through the Feb. 18, 2017, ranking. Songs are ranked based on an inverse point system, with weeks at No. 1 earning the greatest value and weeks at No. 100 earning the least. Due to changes in chart methodology over the years, eras are weighted to account for different chart turnover rates over various periods. TAGS
